description: woman seated on blocks with a baby tied to her back, holding a bowl from which a young boy is drinking; another woman in URC; reclining figure in front center, leaning on a cylindrical object; dog behind drinking boy; hunched figure, LRC, in middle ground
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

see Signed; on back, in brown ink: [P. mariette 1698]
provenance: [Johann Sigmund Bermann, Lugt 235 (1794-1846), Vienna, mark dated 1831.] Pierre Mariette, Lugt 1788-1790 (1634-1716), Paris. [James A. Bergquist, Newton Centre, Mass., until 2006; sold in August for PTOO with Bourdon's Les Pauvres au repos, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2006-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: ULC, in the print: [Seb. Bourdon jnuenit et fecit / L. Boisseuin ex. cum prnit. (?) Regis]
title: L'Enfant qui boit
